brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embraces a modern, minimalistic aesthetic characterized by a high-contrast black and white base palette punctuated by a vivid neon yellow accent. The layout is grid-based and modular, providing clear content separation and generous white space that enhances readability and visual hierarchy. Typography plays a central role, featuring bold, geometric sans-serif fonts with a clean and slightly technical feel, used in large uppercase headings and medium-weight body text. The neon yellow accent color is strategically applied to navigation backgrounds, call-to-action blocks, and highlighted sections, creating energetic focal points without overwhelming the design. UI components are minimal and functional, with simple black text and icons ensuring clarity and accessibility. Overall, the design conveys professionalism, modernity, and creative vibrancy, suitable for contemporary cultural institutions or brands seeking a bold yet clean visual identity.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Bold, modern, professional, and creative with a clear and confident personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color predominantly for text, icons, and key UI elements on light backgrounds to ensure maximum readability. The 'secondary' color serves as the main background, providing a clean and open canvas. The 'neonAccent' color is reserved for highlighting important interactive elements such as navigation bars, call-to-action blocks, and featured content backgrounds, always paired with 'primary' for text to maintain strong contrast. Avoid using 'neonAccent' for text to preserve legibility. The 'primaryForeground' and 'secondaryForeground' colors ensure text and icons stand out clearly against their respective backgrounds. This palette balances high contrast with vibrant energy, supporting accessibility and user engagement.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The combination of 'primary' text on 'secondary' background meets WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards for normal and large text. The 'neonAccent' background with 'primary' text also meets WCAG AA contrast requirements, ensuring readability for call-to-action areas. Black text on white background and vice versa provide optimal contrast. Care should be taken to avoid using 'neonAccent' for small text or low contrast elements to maintain accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in uppercase or sentence case with large sizes to create a commanding presence. Pair headings with the paragraph font to maintain readability and balance. Maintain ample spacing around headings to enhance clarity. Use 'primary' color for headings on light backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' on dark backgrounds. Avoid using the neonAccent color for headings to preserve legibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards. Large font sizes further improve accessibility.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for body text, captions, and smaller UI elements. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing for readability. Use 'primary' color for text on 'secondary' backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' on dark backgrounds. Avoid using neonAccent for body text to ensure contrast and legibility.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meets WCAG AA contrast standards for normal text sizes. Larger text sizes meet AAA standards.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses large, bold headings anchored in the top third of the viewport, creating immediate visual impact. The text is left-aligned with generous white space around it, emphasizing clarity and focus. The neonAccent color is used as a background highlight behind key calls to action, contrasting with black text for readability. This placement draws the user's eye naturally from the top navigation down into the content.

components.containers: Containers use white or neonAccent backgrounds with clear boundaries defined by spacing rather than borders. They maintain consistent padding and margin to separate content blocks, supporting a modular and clean layout. The neonAccent container backgrounds highlight featured content or calls to action, always paired with black text for contrast.
components.images: Images are presented in clean rectangular frames with no borders or shadows, maintaining a minimal and modern look. They are spaced generously from text and other elements to avoid clutter and maintain visual balance.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal and functional, typically black with white text or white with black text depending on background context. The 'Get tickets' button uses a black background with white text for prominence. Links are often underlined black text on white or neonAccent backgrounds, maintaining clarity and accessibility.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, monochromatic black line or solid shapes consistent with the minimalistic style. They are used sparingly in navigation and UI controls to support usability without visual clutter.
graphicElements.illustrations: No decorative illustrations are present; the design relies on photography and abstract art images for visual interest.
graphicElements.stickers: No sticker or badge style elements are used; emphasis is created through color blocks and typography.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a minimalistic and modern aesthetic with a neutral, earthy color palette dominated by soft beige and warm taupe backgrounds. Accent colors in muted terracotta provide subtle warmth and sophistication. Typography is clean and geometric sans-serif, with bold headings and clear, readable body text that enhances clarity and elegance. The layout employs a modular grid with generous negative space, balancing text and imagery in well-defined blocks. Graphic elements are understated, including subtle horizontal lines that add structure without clutter. UI components such as buttons and icons are minimal and monochrome, supporting the overall clean and premium feel. This visual language conveys a sense of natural authenticity, calm confidence, and upscale simplicity, suitable for a variety of lifestyle and wellness brands.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Calm, refined, and approachable with a professional and authentic personality that emphasizes natural beauty and premium quality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: The color system relies on a foundation of subtle neutrals punctuated by earthy warmth. Use the 'background' color as the canvas for the majority of the page to maintain a light, airy feel. The 'secondary' color is specifically reserved for content blocks, cards, or sections within the modular grid, creating a soft contrast against the main background. Text should almost exclusively use the 'foreground' color (or 'secondaryForeground' when on beige blocks) to ensure sharp legibility. The 'primary' color is an accent used sparingly but effectively for graphic anchors (like horizontal separator lines), active states, or key call-to-action links. Avoid using the 'primary' color for large background areas; keep it as a refined highlight.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The palette is designed to meet WCAG AA standards. The combination of 'primary' (terracotta) and 'primaryForeground' (white) passes accessibility checks, as does 'primary' against the 'background'. The 'secondary' beige background provides high contrast for the 'secondaryForeground' dark text, ensuring content within grid blocks is easily readable. The main 'background' and 'foreground' pairing offers excellent contrast for body copy.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in bold weights for primary titles and section headers to establish hierarchy and focus. Pair with the paragraph font for contrast, ensuring ample spacing and line height for readability. Headings should use the 'primary' color for emphasis or 'primaryForeground' on colored backgrounds. Maintain consistent letter spacing and avoid overly tight kerning to preserve clarity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA contrast requirements. Use sufficient font size and weight to ensure legibility across devices.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in regular or medium weights for body text, captions, and secondary information. Text color should primarily be 'primaryForeground' or 'secondaryForeground' depending on background. Maintain comfortable line height and letter spacing to enhance readability. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and balanced page flow.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'primaryForeground' on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA contrast standards. Ensure font sizes are not too small to maintain accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading placed prominently in a modular grid block with ample negative space around it. The heading is left-aligned with supporting text below, creating a clear visual hierarchy. This placement emphasizes clarity and calmness, allowing the typography to breathe and draw attention without distraction.

components.containers: Containers use soft, neutral backgrounds with consistent padding and subtle borders or lines in 'lineSeparator' color to define sections without heavy visual weight. They maintain a clean and open feel, supporting content hierarchy and readability.
components.images: Images are presented without borders or shadows, integrated seamlessly into the grid. They maintain natural proportions and are balanced with text blocks to create visual interest while preserving the minimal aesthetic.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal with subtle outlines or solid fills in 'warmAccent' color. Text on buttons uses 'primaryForeground' for clarity. Hover states may invert colors or increase saturation to indicate interactivity while maintaining elegance.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, monochrome, and line-based, consistent with the minimal and modern style. They use 'primaryForeground' or 'warmAccent' colors to maintain visual harmony.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present, supporting the clean and photographic focus of the design.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, preserving the understated and sophisticated brand image.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a minimalistic and spacious layout with a soft off-white background that creates a calm and neutral canvas. The primary color is a deep forest green used consistently for headings, text, icons, and buttons, conveying reliability and eco-consciousness. A lighter pastel green serves as a secondary color for backgrounds and highlights, adding freshness and subtle vibrancy. Typography combines a modern sans-serif font for headings with a monospaced or typewriter-style font for body text, emphasizing clarity and technical precision. The layout is balanced and column-based with generous white space, rounded corners on images and buttons, and a clean navigation system with pill-shaped buttons. Graphic elements are minimal and line-based, supporting the clean and professional aesthetic. Overall, the design communicates a harmonious blend of technology and sustainability, suitable for a wide range of industries focused on innovation and environmental responsibility.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, and forward-thinking with a focus on sustainability and innovation. The tone is calm, precise, and approachable, reflecting a brand that is both technologically advanced and environmentally conscious.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for all main text elements, headings, icons, and primary buttons to establish brand recognition and ensure readability. The 'secondary' color is ideal for backgrounds of interactive elements such as highlighted job listings and call-to-action buttons, providing a fresh and inviting contrast to the 'primary' color. The 'background' color should be used as the base canvas for pages to maintain a soft, neutral environment that reduces eye strain and enhances content focus. Text on 'primary' backgrounds should use 'primaryForeground' to ensure high contrast and accessibility, while text on 'secondary' backgrounds should use 'secondaryForeground' for clarity. Avoid mixing colors outside this palette to maintain brand consistency and a cohesive visual identity.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color (#0B3D2E) on the 'background' (#F5F5F0) provides excellent contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for both normal and large text. Text in 'primaryForeground' (#FFFFFF) on 'primary' backgrounds also meets WCAG AA contrast requirements. The 'secondary' color (#C7E6C1) with 'secondaryForeground' (#0B3D2E) ensures sufficient contrast for readability on interactive elements. Overall, the palette supports accessible design for users with visual impairments and maintains legibility across devices.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to create a clear visual hierarchy. Italic styles can be applied selectively to emphasize key words or concepts, adding subtle dynamism without compromising readability. Pair headings with the monospaced paragraph font to balance modernity with technical precision. Maintain consistent spacing and avoid overcrowding to preserve the minimalistic aesthetic. Ensure headings use the 'primary' color for strong brand presence and accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AA contrast standards, ensuring readability for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, captions, and smaller UI text to maintain clarity and a technical feel. The monospaced style supports the brand's technology focus and contrasts well with the sans-serif headings. Text should primarily use the 'primary' color on the 'background' for optimal readability. Maintain adequate line height and spacing to enhance legibility, especially for longer text blocks.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements, supporting accessible reading experiences.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the headline and key messaging in the top third of the viewport, aligned left to create a natural reading flow. This placement is visually balanced by a large image on the right with rounded corners, creating a harmonious split layout. The typography uses large, bold headings with italic emphasis on key words to draw attention, supported by smaller, monospaced body text below. Generous white space surrounds the text, enhancing focus and readability while maintaining a clean, modern aesthetic.

components.containers: Containers use soft rounded corners and subtle background colors like 'secondary' for emphasis. They maintain consistent padding and margins to create a clean, organized structure. Borders are minimal or absent, relying on color and spacing for separation.
components.images: Images have rounded corners to soften the visual impact and integrate smoothly with the overall minimalistic design. They are balanced with text content and sized to maintain harmony within the grid layout.
components.buttons: Primary buttons use the 'primary' color with white text ('primaryForeground'), featuring rounded edges and a solid fill for clear call-to-action emphasis. Secondary buttons or less prominent actions use the 'secondary' background with 'secondaryForeground' text, often outlined or with subtle shadows to maintain hierarchy.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, line-based, and use the 'primary' color to maintain consistency and clarity. They are simple and functional, supporting navigation and interaction without distraction.
graphicElements.illustrations: No prominent illustrations are used; the design relies on realistic photography with natural colors, which are excluded from the core palette.
graphicElements.stickers: Stickers or badges, such as the 'Top 20' label, use the 'secondary' background with 'primary' text and rounded corners, maintaining the brand's clean and approachable style.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design employs a minimalist and monochromatic aesthetic centered on a high-contrast black and white color scheme. The layout is grid-based and modular, with generous negative space that enhances clarity and focus. Typography is modern, geometric, and sans-serif, featuring large, uppercase headings and clean, readable body text that conveys professionalism and luxury. Imagery is used sparingly but prominently, showcasing high-quality vehicle photos that reinforce the premium brand identity. UI components such as buttons and containers maintain the monochrome palette with subtle borders and clean lines, supporting a sleek and timeless visual style. Overall, the design communicates exclusivity, refinement, and a contemporary luxury experience.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Sophisticated, professional, modern, and confident with a focus on luxury and exclusivity.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: The color system is strictly binary. Use the 'primary' color for high-impact sections, headers, and footers to create a sense of depth and luxury. Text within these sections must always use the 'primaryForeground' color. The 'background' color serves as the canvas for standard content areas, showcasing text in the 'foreground' color. The 'secondary' color is effectively identical to the 'background' in this monochromatic theme but can be used for cards or distinct content blocks if a slight variation is introduced later. Use the 'gridLine' color to draw the explicit borders that define the layout's structure. The 'subtleText' color should be reserved for meta-data or less critical information, ensuring it remains legible against the 'background'. Avoid introducing any other colors; the power of this brand lies in its restraint.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The palette relies on maximum contrast. The combination of 'primary' (black) and 'primaryForeground' (white) yields a contrast ratio of approximately 19:1, far exceeding WCAG AAA standards. Similarly, the 'background' and 'foreground' pairing offers the same high-level contrast. The 'secondary' and 'secondaryForeground' pair also meets AAA standards. Ensure that the 'gridLine' color maintains enough contrast to be visible but not distracting. The 'subtleText' against 'background' should be checked to ensure it stays above 4.5:1 for AA compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to create strong visual impact and hierarchy. Headings should be uppercase or large size with generous letter spacing to enhance readability and modernity. Pair headings with the paragraph font to maintain contrast and balance. Maintain consistent spacing above and below headings to preserve clean layout and flow. Use 'primaryForeground' color for headings on 'primary' backgrounds and 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds to ensure accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background and 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards, ensuring clear legibility for all users.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and smaller informational content. Maintain appropriate line height and letter spacing for readability, especially on black backgrounds with white text. Paragraphs should contrast with headings by using smaller sizes and normal casing. Use 'primaryForeground' color on 'primary' backgrounds and 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds to maintain accessibility and visual harmony.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text combinations with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background and 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA contrast requirements for normal and large text, ensuring accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section typography is anchored in the top third of the viewport, creating immediate visual impact upon page load. Large, bold headings dominate the upper area with ample negative space around them, emphasizing clarity and luxury. The text is left-aligned with generous line spacing and letter spacing, reinforcing the modern and minimalist aesthetic. This placement draws the user's attention quickly to the brand message while maintaining balance with the rest of the layout.

components.containers: Containers use solid black or white backgrounds with subtle thin borders or no borders to maintain a clean and minimalist look. They provide clear separation of content blocks while preserving the monochrome palette and high contrast.
components.images: Images are large, high-quality, and centrally placed with no decorative frames or overlays. They serve as focal points and are integrated seamlessly into the grid layout, maintaining balance with text content.
components.buttons: Buttons have a white background with black text, featuring minimalistic rectangular shapes with subtle padding. They stand out against the black background and use the 'secondary' and 'secondaryForeground' colors to maintain consistency and accessibility.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal or absent, but if used, they would be simple line icons in white or black to match the monochrome theme.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present; the design relies on photography and typography for visual interest.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, preserving the clean and uncluttered aesthetic.

brandBook.toneOfVoice: Bold, modern, professional, and creative with a clear and confident personality.

components.images: Images are presented in clean rectangular frames with no borders or shadows, maintaining a minimal and modern look. They are spaced generously from text and other elements to avoid clutter and maintain visual balance.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal and functional, typically black with white text or white with black text depending on background context. The 'Get tickets' button uses a black background with white text for prominence. Links are often underlined black text on white or neonAccent backgrounds, maintaining clarity and accessibility.

They maintain consistent padding and margin to separate content blocks, supporting a modular and clean layout. The neonAccent container backgrounds highlight featured content or calls to action, always paired with black text for contrast.

Pair headings with the paragraph font to maintain readability and balance. Maintain ample spacing around headings to enhance clarity. Use 'primary' color for headings on light backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' on dark backgrounds. Avoid using the neonAccent color for headings to preserve legibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards. Large font sizes further improve accessibility.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for body text, captions, and smaller UI elements. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing for readability. Use 'primary' color for text on 'secondary' backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' on dark backgrounds. Avoid using neonAccent for body text to ensure contrast and legibility.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meets WCAG AA contrast standards for normal text sizes. Larger text sizes meet AAA standards.

The text is left-aligned with generous white space around it, emphasizing clarity and focus. The neonAccent color is used as a background highlight behind key calls to action, contrasting with black text for readability. This placement draws the user's eye naturally from the top navigation down into the content.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, monochromatic black line or solid shapes consistent with the minimalistic style. They are used sparingly in navigation and UI controls to support usability without visual clutter.
graphicElements.stickers: No sticker or badge style elements are used; emphasis is created through color blocks and typography.
graphicElements.illustrations: No decorative illustrations are present; the design relies on photography and abstract art images for visual interest.

The layout is grid-based and modular, providing clear content separation and generous white space that enhances readability and visual hierarchy. Typography plays a central role, featuring bold, geometric sans-serif fonts with a clean and slightly technical feel, used in large uppercase headings and medium-weight body text. The neon yellow accent color is strategically applied to navigation backgrounds, call-to-action blocks, and highlighted sections, creating energetic focal points without overwhelming the design. palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color predominantly for text, icons, and key UI elements on light backgrounds to ensure maximum readability. The 'secondary' color serves as the main background, providing a clean and open canvas. The 'neonAccent' color is reserved for highlighting important interactive elements such as navigation bars, call-to-action blocks, and featured content backgrounds, always paired with 'primary' for text to maintain strong contrast. initialPrompt: Create a website for an educational cybersecurity tool that simulates brute force and dictionary password attacks. The site should have a simple HTML/CSS frontend and PHP backend, running locally. Features: select attack mode (dictionary or brute force), input target password (plain or hashed), upload or enter wordlist for dictionary attack, set max attempts, and start simulation. Results should show if password was cracked, matched password, attempts, and time elapsed. Emphasize educational purpose and password strength. No third-party libraries; clean code with comments. Professional, simple styling.
